hypotheses.title: Add comprehensive CLI help text with examples and auto-generated subcommand documentation
hypotheses.description: Implement detailed help text for all commands, including usage examples, flags, and return values. Use automatic documentation generation from docstrings to reduce maintenance overhead.

hypotheses.title: Add structured logging with request/response tracing for debugging and troubleshooting
hypotheses.description: Implement structured logging using json format, add request/response tracing IDs, and create a logging configuration that supports different verbosity levels. This will help diagnose issues in production and development environments.

hypotheses.title: Add unit test coverage for error handling paths and edge cases
hypotheses.description: Create unit tests specifically targeting error scenarios, edge cases, and validation logic that are currently untested. This ensures robustness and prevents regressions when code changes.

hypotheses.title: Implement caching layer to reduce redundant computations in frequently-called functions
hypotheses.description: Add memoization or a caching mechanism (like functools.lru_cache or Redis) for expensive operations that are called with same inputs. Profile hot paths first to identify appropriate candidates.

parsed.rationale: H2 provides the best balance of value-to-risk ratio while addressing a critical axis (observability) that is frequently overlooked but essential for production systems. Structured logging and tracing significantly improve debuggability without high risk of breaking existing functionality. H1 (ux_cli) also has strong potential but requires careful wording of examples to avoid outdated documentation. H2 can be implemented incrementally and provides immediate value to development and ops teams.
